channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Pakistan bans hard-line Islamist party known for its fierce anti-blasphemy stance
item.description: Pakistan banned a hard-line Islamist party on Thursday, more than a week after heated clashes with police that left at least five people dead.

item.title: It's been a rollercoaster few years for Six Flags. Can Travis Kelce help?
item.description: Travis Kelce is teaming up with activist investors in hopes of transforming the embattled theme park operator Six Flags. No word yet on a Taylor Swift...

item.title: Coffee-driven deforestation is making it harder to grow coffee, watchdog group says
item.description: In Brazil's coffee-producing areas, more than 42,000 square miles of forest have disappeared over about two decades, says Coffee Watch. Deforestation ...

item.title: The federal government is still shut down. Here's what that means across the country
item.description: The federal government shutdown continues. Republicans and Democrats appear no closer to an agreement to end it. Many federal workers are missing full...

item.title: U.S. imposes sanctions on Colombia's president and family over drug trade allegations
item.description: The sanctions sharply escalate tensions with the leftist leader of a country that has traditionally been one of the closest U.S. allies in South Ameri...

item.title: Ontario to stop running anti-tariff advert that angered Trump
item.description: The advertisement will be paused from Monday so "trade talks can resume", Doug Ford says.

item.title: Shots fired, driver hurt and held after truck rams into Coast Guard base in San Francisco
Cheating expert explains poker rigging technology amid NBA gambling scandal
item.description: New details of federal investigations into illegal betting and gambling scandals have sent shockwaves through the NBA. The FBI arrested 34 people in c...

item.title: What is known — and not known — about U.S. strikes on alleged drug boats
item.description: Since September, the U.S. has been carrying out strikes on alleged drug cartel boats in the Caribbean and eastern Pacific Ocean.

item.title: Trump says tech leaders and mayor changed his mind about using federal force in San Francisco
Tropical Storm Melissa forecast to become major hurricane this weekend
item.description: Tropical Storm Melissa is expected to bring days of downpours to the Dominican Republic, Haiti and Jamaica and may trigger catastrophic flash flooding...

item.title: US sends world's largest warship towards Caribbean as it ramps up military presence
item.description: The deployment of the USS Gerald R Ford marks a major escalation in what the US says is a campaign to target drug traffickers.

item.title: What's in Reagan advert that caused US-Canada trade talks collapse?
item.description: Comparing the controversial advert quoting Ronald Reagan on tariffs with his original address.

item.title: Border Patrol commander Bovino ordered to face federal judge in Chicago
item.description: A federal judge in Chicago has ordered Border Patrol commander Gregory Bovino to attend a hearing in her courtroom next week, amid concerns about fede...

item.title: Jeffries endorses Mamdani in NYC mayor's race
item.description: Jeffries' endorsement is the latest show of support for the Democratic assemblyman from Queens and frontrunner in the polls.

item.title: Woman gets rare whole-life sentence for murder of French schoolgirl
item.description: Dahbia Benkired is the first woman in France to receive a full life term following the shocking crime.

item.title: Ukraine allies pledge to take Russian oil and gas off global market
item.description: A "coalition of the willing" meeting in London seeks to increase pressure on Russia to end its war in Ukraine.

item.title: National Guard deployments in DC and Portland, Oregon, are focus of court hearings
item.description: The deployment of National Guard troops in Washington, D.C., faces a challenge in a court in the nation’s capital.
